channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: A&E queues mean Wales' ambulances 'can't take 999 calls'
item.description: Paramedics say they are spending more time waiting on hospital tarmac than taking 999 calls.

item.title: Mumbles: Boy, 12, in hospital after open-top bus crash
item.description: Several other people also sustained minor injuries after the sight-seeing bus crashed.

item.title: Wales plan for capacity autumn series crowds
item.description: The WRU will offer full refunds if Covid-19 disrupts plans for capacity crowds when Wales face New Zealand, South Africa, Fiji and Australia in the autumn.

item.title: Kirsty Williams: Abuse of women in politics getting worse
item.description: Kirsty Williams says she could not keep her family safe from trolling while Welsh education minister.

item.title: Climate change: Fisherman stops farming mussels due to hot weather
item.description: A shellfish farmer says its no longer viable to continue farming mussels due to warmer temperatures.

item.title: Gower salt marsh lamb receives protected status
item.description: The meat from lambs born and bred on the Gower Peninsula is now protected from copycat rivals.

item.title: Lauren Price: 'Insane' welcome for Olympic gold medallist
item.description: Hundreds of people line the streets to welcome home boxing gold medallist Lauren Price.

item.title: Covid: Swansea DVLA balloting for more strike action
item.description: Workers are being asked if they support more action over Covid safety.

item.title: Covid has 'accelerated' industrial automation in Wales
item.description: New technology investments ramp up in Welsh manufacturing - but will it mean fewer workers?

item.title: Carmarthenshire council: 'Significant' planning problems
item.description: Almost 850 planning applications were waiting to be determined, some dating back five years.

item.title: A-levels 2021 in Wales: Grades above pre-Covid levels
item.description: A total of 48.3% of A-level grades are A and A* in Wales, which is hailed a "remarkable achievement".

item.title: Doctor worked at Wrexham Maelor hospital while off sick at another
item.description: Joao Muel said he was unfit to work in Abergavenny while doing shifts in Wrexham, a tribunal hears.

item.title: Wales: Post-lockdown demand on ambulance staff 'relentless'
item.description: Paramedics and control room staff share their stories as pressure on services rises.

item.title: Lauren Price: Olympic boxer overwhelmed by 'insane' reception
item.description: The Welsh boxing champion was given a hero's welcome on her return to Ystrad Mynach.

item.title: A-levels 2021 in Wales: Pupils celebrate after tough year
item.description: Pupils receive their A-level results after a mix of online and in-person learning.

item.title: Rhyl cancer patient Ann Jones: 'There should have been more done'
item.description: A woman criticises the care her late mother received following the publication of a watchdog's report.

item.title: Wrexham man left fighting for life after refusing Covid jab
item.description: Gym-goer Artur Brylowski refused a vaccine and is now in intensive care with Covid.

item.title: Pollution: 'This is my coffin, this is why I swim with it'
item.description: Wild swimmer Angela Jones says she hopes her specially designed coffin will catch attention.

item.title: Lauren Price: Tokyo Olympics boxing champion reveals approach from promoter Eddie Hearn
item.description: Olympic boxing champion Lauren Price says she plans talks with promoter Eddie Hearn about the prospect of turning professional.

item.title: Timmy Abraham: Chelsea striker Tammy's younger brother making headlines
item.description: They are playing at vastly different levels, but Timmy Abraham, younger brother of Chelsea's Tammy, is making headlines at Newport.

item.title: Cardiff City 3-2 Sutton United: Debutant Marley Watkins scores twice in EFL Cup
item.description: Sutton United are denied a shock win in their first EFL Cup game as Marley Watkins scores twice on debut to give Cardiff City a first-round victory.

item.title: Reading 0-3 Swansea City: Boss Russell Martin claims first Swans win in EFL Cup cruise
item.description: Swansea City win for the first time under Russell Martin as they cruise into the EFL Cup second round thanks to a 3-0 victory at Reading.

item.title: Ipswich Town 0-1 Newport County: Timmy Abraham strike gives Exiles EFL Cup win at Ipswich
item.description: Timmy Abraham's early goal sees Newport reach the EFL Cup second round at the expense of hosts Ipswich Town.

item.title: 'Mwy o straen ar ambiwlansys nawr nag ar frig y pandemig'
item.description: Staff y Gwasanaeth Ambiwlans ar ben eu tennyn, gan ddweud mai dyma'u cyfnod prysuraf erioed.

item.title: Adran gynllunio Sir Gâr wedi gorwario o £1.8m y flwyddyn
item.description: Mae'r adran yn gorwario o £1.8m y flwyddyn, ond mae cannoedd o geisiadau eto i gael eu sylw.

item.title: 'Sarhad o fenywod mewn gwleidyddiaeth yn gwaethygu'
item.description: Y cyn-Weinidog Addysg Kirsty Williams fu'n rhannu ei phrofiadau o gamdriniaeth ar-lein gyda BBC Cymru.

item.title: Llion Williams: Lloches ar ynysoedd yr Alban
item.description: Yr actor sy'n egluro pam ei fod yn byw yn yr Alban am gyfnod a'i rybuddion i Gymru o'r Ynys Hir.

item.title: Tri chlwb Cymru trwodd i ail rownd Cwpan yr EFL
item.description: Caerdydd yn trechu Sutton United, Abertawe yn fuddugol yn Reading a Chasnewydd yn ennill yn Ipswich.
